description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 27 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. European glazed paper with watermark. Small piece of paper with inscriptions and short excerpts between fol. 5 and 6. Collation: Paper, fol. 107 ; 1¹⁰ (-1, before fol. 1) 2-10¹⁰ 11¹⁰ (-2, after fol. 107) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Copy completed by Sulaymān al-Dāʼūdī on 9 Jumādá al-Thānīyah 1057 [July 12, 1647] (colophon, fol. 107a). Incipit: الحمد لله الذي انزل على عبده الكتاب تبياما لكل شي ... وبعد فقد قال الله تعالى ونزلنا عليك الكتاب تبيانا لكل شي وقال ما فرطنا في الكتاب من شي Explicit:المنادى المنذر الناس النبى النجم الثابت الندير نعمة الله النور الهدى الولي يس وصلى الله وسلم عليه وعلى اله وصحبه وسلم يا رب العالمين امين تم الكتاب
author: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505
abstract: Treatise on sciences of the Qurʼān.
extent: 107 leaves: paper ; 199 x 135 (157 x 80) mm. bound to 200 x 145 mm.
title: al-Iklīl fī istinbāṭ al-tanzīl
provenance: Ownership statement signed Muḥammad Abū al-Saʻūd ibn Sulaymān al-Dāʼūdī, who acquired the ms. from his father. Two ownership statements, signed Muṣṭafá Abū al-Saʻūd al-Dāʼūdī and ʻUmar Abū al-Saʻūd al-Dāʼūdī al-Anṣārī on fol. 107b. Several reading statements on fol. 1a, signed ʻAbd Allāh and al-Malik ʻUbayd Allāh ; ʻAbd al-[---?]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: سيوطي
subject: Qurʼan—Criticism, interpretation, etc—Early works to 1800
binding note: Paper on paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Brown leather spine and borders. Paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
